law.catch_line: Individuals who can and cannot take depositions -- Penalty.

section.section: For the purposes of paragraph (a) of this subsection, "employee" includes a person who has a contractual relationship with a person or entity interested in the outcome of the litigation, including anyone who may ultimately be responsible for payment to provide reporting or other court services, and a person who is employed part-time or full-time under contract or otherwise by a person who has a contractual relationship with a party to provide reporting or other court services.
If a deposition is taken by a person described in paragraph (a) of this subsection, then that deposition shall be void.

text.section: The provisions of subsections (1) and (2) of this section shall not apply to contracts for court reporting services for the courts, agencies, or instrumentalities of the United States or the Commonwealth.
Any person who takes a deposition in violation of subsection (2) of this section shall be guilty of a Class B misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 224, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998.
